rlGalMibVersion.name: rlGalMibVersion
rlGalMibVersion.description: MIB's version, the current version is 1.

rlGalMode.name: rlGalMode
rlGalMode.description: Current mode supported by the device.

rlGalModeAfterReset.name: rlGalModeAfterReset
rlGalModeAfterReset.description: New mode supported by the device after the next reset.

rlPolicyGalileoTuningOverProvisioning.name: rlPolicyGalileoTuningOverProvisioning
rlPolicyGalileoTuningOverProvisioning.description: For non-quantitative flows: Defines the function that is used to devide the aggregate rate (dependent on the number of flows using the specific meterId). The options for this mib variables are: - overProvisioning is 1/n -> may cause severe exceeding from permitted bw. - minorOverProvisioning is 1/(n+1)-> may cause minor exceeding from permitted bw. - underProvisioning is 1/(2^n) -> usaully causes to be under the permitted bw. where n is the number of flows using the specific meterId, initial value = 1.

rlPolicyGalileoTuningExtremConditionBurs.name: rlPolicyGalileoTuningExtremConditionBurstSize
rlPolicyGalileoTuningExtremConditionBurs.description: This variable indicates the value of a new burst size, when the given aggregate burst size has reached the following extreme condition: (aggregateBurstSize/n) < 1536 (smaller than max MTU). The options for this mib variables are: - new burst = 0 bytes - new burst = 1536 bytes where n is the number of flows using the specific meterId.

rlPolicyGalileoTuningOverrideOutOfProfil.name: rlPolicyGalileoTuningOverrideOutOfProfileDropPrecedence
rlPolicyGalileoTuningOverrideOutOfProfil.description: This mib variable is used only when the rlPolicyGalileoTuningExtremConditionBurstSize is 0 bytes. The options for this mib variables are: - TRUE => out of profile Drop Precedence = High Drop Precedence. This value will override the rule's out of profile Drop Precedence. - FALSE => out of profile Drop Precedence is set according to the rule's decision.

rlCosFftAgingTimeout.name: rlCosFftAgingTimeout
rlCosFftAgingTimeout.description: The aging timeout of the CoS FFT Tables.

rlCosFftPollingInterval.name: rlCosFftPollingInterval
rlCosFftPollingInterval.description: The polling interval for dynamic CoS FFTs support in seconds.

RlPolicyGalileoDebugGroupType.name: RlPolicyGalileoDebugGroupType
RlPolicyGalileoDebugGroupType.description: Specifies one of 3 types for which offset bytes can be specified. For Ip,bridge and Ipx

rlPolicyGalileoDebugFlowTable.description: This table will allow us to request variables from specific entry at the flowTable. only get and getNext will be supported (getNext will return alyaws EndOfMibTable)

rlPolicyGalileoFcuFwdCpuCounter.description: Count the number of packets that forward from the Flow Classification Unit to the CPU

RlPolicySimpleGalMibProfileType.description: Specifies one of 4 services the device can support

rlPolicySimpleGalMibVersion.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibVersion
rlPolicySimpleGalMibVersion.description: MIB's version, the current version is 1.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibPortTypeSupport.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibPortTypeSupport
rlPolicySimpleGalMibPortTypeSupport.description: return a bit mask that indicates the supported port type: ---------- |87654321| ---------- 1 - BoundaryType 2 - InteriorType

rlPolicySimpleGalMibRecalculateRules.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibRecalculateRules
rlPolicySimpleGalMibRecalculateRules.description: Setting any value will cause recalculation of all the rules.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibPolicyEnable.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibPolicyEnable
rlPolicySimpleGalMibPolicyEnable.description: Enables or disables the policy feature

rlPolicySimpleGalMibProfileTable.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibProfileTable
rlPolicySimpleGalMibProfileTable.description: The table defines all the profiles.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibDescription.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibDescription
rlPolicySimpleGalMibDescription.description: Informational text given by the user to describe the profile.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibRate.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibRate
rlPolicySimpleGalMibRate.description: The rate in kilobytes/second for the specified profile, or in the case of minDelay per session profile type the rate will indicate the rate per individual session

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBurstSize.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBurstSize
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBurstSize.description: The burst size parameter. A value of 0 means that the device should choose the Burst Size that is most suitable for the profile.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibMaxSession.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibMaxSession
rlPolicySimpleGalMibMaxSession.description: Relevant only for the minDelay per session. Indicate the maximum number of sessions for this profile.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibNewVpt.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibNewVpt
rlPolicySimpleGalMibNewVpt.description: Indicates the new VPT to assign to the packet.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibChangeTosOrDscp.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibChangeTosOrDscp
rlPolicySimpleGalMibChangeTosOrDscp.description: Indicates whether the TOS or DSCP should be remarked with a new value

rlPolicySimpleGalMibNewTosOrDscp.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibNewTosOrDscp
rlPolicySimpleGalMibNewTosOrDscp.description: Indicates the new value for the TOS or DSCP. Relevant only if rlPolicySimpleGalMibChangeTosOrDscp is true.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibStatus.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibStatus
rlPolicySimpleGalMibStatus.description: The status of a table entry. It is used to delete an entry from this table.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogTable.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogTable
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogTable.description: This table defines the used fields for ip classification, per port type (interior/boundary)

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogEntry.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogEntry
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogEntry.description: the entry define the used fields for classification

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogPortType.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogPortType
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogPortType.description: The port type (interior/boundary) to which this entry applies.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogTosOrDscp.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogTosOrDscp
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogTosOrDscp.description: Indicates whether the IP TOS or DSCP field will be used in classifiers or not.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogProtocol.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogProtocol
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogProtocol.description: Indicates whether the IP L4 protocol field will be used in classifiers or not.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogSrcIpMask.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogSrcIpMask
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogSrcIpMask.description: Indicates the number of most significant bits of the Ip Address that are used in specifying IP source addresses in classifiers.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogDstIpMask.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogDstIpMask
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogDstIpMask.description: Indicates the number of most significant bits of the Ip Address that are used in specifying IP destination addresses in classifiers.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogSrcPort.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogSrcPort
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogSrcPort.description: Indicates whether the IP L4 protocol source port field will be used in classifiers or not.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogDstPort.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogDstPort
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogDstPort.description: Indicates whether the IP L4 protocol destination port field will be used in classifiers or not.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogInIfIndex.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogInIfIndex
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpFcogInIfIndex.description: Indicates whether ifIndex of input ports will be used in classifiers or not.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesTable.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesTable
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesTable.description: This table contains the policy rules defined by the user. The order of the entries in the table is important, since the first rule that applies to the incoming packet will be acted upon, ignoring any further rules that may apply as well.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesEntry.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesEntry
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesEntry.description: This entry defines one policy rule.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesPortType.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesPortType
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesPortType.description: The port type (interior/boundary) to which this rule applies.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesIndex.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesIndex
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesIndex.description: This enumerates the table. The user should assign indices in such a way that there will be a gap big enough between one rule and the next to allow insertion of additional rules in between (a gap of 1000 is recommended).

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesDescription.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesDescription
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesDescription.description: Informational text given by the user to describe the rule.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesTosOrDscp.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesTosOrDscp
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesTosOrDscp.description: Indicates the TOS or DSCP to compare with.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesProtocol.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesProtocol
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesProtocol.description: Indicates the L4 protocol to compare with.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesSrcIp.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesSrcIp
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesSrcIp.description: Indicates the source IP address to compare with.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesSrcIpMask.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesSrcIpMask
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesSrcIpMask.description: Indicates the number of most significant bits of the Ip Address that are used in specifying IP source addresses in classifiers.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesDstIp.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesDstIp
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesDstIp.description: Indicates the destination IP address to compare with.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesDstIpMask.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesDstIpMask
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesDstIpMask.description: Indicates the number of most significant bits of the Ip Address that are used in specifying IP destination addresses in classifiers.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesSrcPort.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesSrcPort
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesSrcPort.description: Indicates the source L4 port to compare with.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesDstPort.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesDstPort
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesDstPort.description: Indicates the destination L4 port to compare with.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesInIfIndexList.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesInIfIndexList
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesInIfIndexList.description: Indicates the list of input ports to which this rule applies.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesCondition.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesCondition
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesCondition.description: Indicate the relation that should hold for each relevant field of the rule in comparison to the packet's field.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesAction.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesAction
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesAction.description: Indicates the action to be performed if there is a match with the rule.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesProfilePointe.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesProfilePointer
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesProfilePointe.description: Indicates the profile attached to the rule. The value is the index in the profile table of the attached profile. Value 0 means that no profile is attached to the rule and is valid only in case of action block.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesOutIfIndexLis.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesOutIfIndexList
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesOutIfIndexLis.description: Indicates the list of output ports to on which bandwidth should be allocated for this rule.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesBitsUsed.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesBitsUsed
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesBitsUsed.description: a bit mask that indicates the the used fields for the entry: (the implemention is identical to BITS implementation,from MSB to LSB) ---------- |87654321| ---------- 8 - tosOrDscp 7 - Protocol 6 - SrcIp 5 - DstIp 4 - SrcIpPort 3 - DstIpPort

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesErrorDescrip.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesErrorDescrip
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesErrorDescrip.description: A description error indicate the user about the specific error. The error can cause by one of the following reasons: 1. if the profile was asign to the rule could not be perform 2. if the operation of QoS portLock failed

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesStatus.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesStatus
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpRulesStatus.description: The status of a table entry. It is used to delete an entry from this table. notInService is used to disable an entry. notReady will be assigned by the device to indicate that the rule can not be active because some ports in the output ports list are not in a state allowing bandwidth allocation guarantee.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpxRulesTable.description: This table contains the policy rules defined by the user. The order of the entries in the table is important, since the first rule that matches the incoming packet will be acted upon, ignoring any further rules that may match as well.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpxRulesEntry.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpxRulesEntry

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpxRulesCondition.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpxRulesCondition

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpxRulesAction.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpxRulesAction

rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpxRulesProfilePoint.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpxRulesProfilePointer
rlPolicySimpleGalMibIpxRulesProfilePoint.description: Indicates the profile attached to the rule. The value is the index in the profile table of the attached profile. Value 0 means that no profile is attached to the rule and is valid only in case of action block.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeFcogIpSrcIpMas.description: Indicate the number of used bits of the Ip Address from the left

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeFcogIpDstIpMas.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeFcogIpDstIpMask
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeFcogIpDstIpMas.description: Indicate the number of used bits of the Ip Address from the left

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeFcogIpSrcPort.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeFcogIpSrcPort
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeFcogIpSrcPort.description: Indicate whether the field is in use in the rules

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeFcogIpDstPort.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeFcogIpDstPort
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeFcogIpDstPort.description: Indicate whether the field is in use in the rules

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesTable.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesTable
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesTable.description: This table contains the policy rules defined by the user. The order of the entries in the table is important, since the first rule that applies to the incoming packet will be acted upon, ignoring any further rules that may apply as well.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesEntry.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesEntry
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesEntry.description: This entry defines one policy rule.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesIndex.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesIndex
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesIndex.description: This enumerates the table. The user should assign indices in such a way that there will be a gap big enough between one rule and the next to allow insertion of additional rules in between (a gap of 1000 is recommended).

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesDescripti.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesDescription
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesDescripti.description: Informational text given by the user to describe the rule.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesDstMac.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesDstMac
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesDstMac.description: Indicate the Dst mac to compare

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesSrcMac.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesSrcMac
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesSrcMac.description: Indicate the source mac to compare

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesInIfIndex.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesInIfIndexList
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesInIfIndex.description: Indicates the list of input ports to which this rule applies.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesEthType.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesEthType
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesEthType.description: Indicate the Ethernet type of the packet

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesIpTosOrDs.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesIpTosOrDscp
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesIpTosOrDs.description: Indicates the tos or dscp to compare

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesIpSrcPort.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesIpSrcPort
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesIpSrcPort.description: Indicate the Src port to compare

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesIpDstPort.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesIpDstPort
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesIpDstPort.description: Indicate the Src port to compare

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesCondition.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesCondition
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesCondition.description: Indicate the relation that should hold for each relevant field of the rule in comparison to the packet's field.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesAction.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesAction
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesAction.description: Indicates the action to be performed if there is a match with the rule.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesProfilePo.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesProfilePointer
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesProfilePo.description: Indicates the profile attached to the rule. The value is the index in the profile table of the attached profile. Value 0 means that no profile is attached to the rule and is valid only in case of action block.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesOutIfInde.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesOutIfIndexList
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesOutIfInde.description: Indicates the list of output ports to on which bandwidth should be allocated for this rule.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesStatus.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesStatus
rlPolicySimpleGalMibBridgeRulesStatus.description: The status of a table entry. It is used to delete an entry from this table. notInService is used to disable an entry. notReady will be assigned by the device to indicate that the rule can not be active because some ports in the output ports list are not in a state allowing bandwidth allocation guarantee.

rlPolicySimpleGalMibPortTable.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibPortTable
rlPolicySimpleGalMibPortTable.description: The table defines all of the ports types

rlPolicySimpleGalMibPortEntry.name: rlPolicySimpleGalMibPortEntry
rlPolicySimpleGalMibPortEntry.description: An entry defines a port's type

rlGalPolicyMode.name: rlGalPolicyMode
rlGalPolicyMode.description: Indicates whether the QoS is for: -All Bridged packets; or -All routed IP packets. The value cannot change after system init
